intro: Tulbaghia galpinii, commonly known as the Cape tulbaghia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are evergreen. Tulbaghia galpinii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant aroma.
